directly recovered from resonant diffuse scattering.
31. Shannon, R. D. Revised effective ionic radii and systematic studies of interatomic
32. Burton, B. P. & Cockayne, E. Why Pb(B,B’)O

34. Tkachuk, A. & Chen, H. Anti-ferrodistortive nanodomains in PMN relaxor.

Underneath the Bragg Peaks: Structural Analysis of
42. Dmowski, W. et al. Local lattice dynamics and the origin of the relaxor
The ceramic PMN sample used in this study was prepared by Russell Maier. The
octahedral deformation-mode analysis was developed by Anton Gagin. We thank the
STFC (UK) for access to the ISIS neutron facility. Portions of this research were carried
out at the National Synchrotron Light Source II (NIST beamline 6-BM) and Advanced
Photon Source (beamline 11-ID-B), the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Ofﬁce of
Science User Facilities, operated for the DOE Ofﬁce of Science by Brookhaven National
Laboratory and Argonne National Laboratory, respectively, under Contracts Nos
M.E. developed the computer algorithms and software, with major contributions from
V.K., and performed structural reﬁnements and data analysis. H.Y.P., K.C., J.W., and
B.R. collected neutron total scattering, X-ray total scattering, and EXAFS data,
respectively. A.B. collected single-crystal diffuse-scattering data and reconstructed the
3D diffuse-intensity distributions. I.L. conceived and guided the study, collected and
analyzed data, and wrote the paper with input from M.E. and V.K. All the authors
The authors declare no competing interests.
Takenaka, Andrew Goodwin and other anonymous reviewers for their contribution to
the peer review of this work.
